channel.title: General on Keep Calm and Carry On Coding
channel.description: Recent content in General on Keep Calm and Carry On Coding

item.title: Installaion Guide of MongoDB on MAC
item.description: Installaion Guide of MongoDB on MAC Guide on the Official Website brew tap mongodb/brew brew install mongo mongod --config /usr/local/etc/mongod.conf Alternatively, to run MongoDB as a macOS service, issue the following (the process uses the /usr/local/etc/mongod.conf file, created during the install): brew services start mongodb-community@4.0 MongoDB GUI: Robo 3T http://robomongo.org

item.title: Guide to host Hugo with Github Page
item.description: Prerequisites Mac Github 2FA enabled Git installed Github regular personal user (not Enterprise) Github page created Github Create a NEW repo on Github, e.g. blog, so the url for this new repo should be https://github.com/<username>/blog Go to Settings Developer settings Personal access tokens Generate new token Click the options Generate Copy to somewhere safe Now you have a token/password/passphrase. Local brew install hugo hugo new site whatever cd '$path_of_anywhere_you_choose' git clone https://github.
